item.title: Main Lower Lobe Cargo Doors – One Latch or Hinge Section

remarks.para: One latch or hinge section per door may be missing or inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: A visual check is made before departure to ensure that there is no damage to remaining hinge sections or latches on the associated door,
Flight is conducted in an unpressurized configuration,

Procedures are established and used to verify main deck and lower lobe cargo compartments remain empty or contain only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits,
Extended overwater flight is prohibited, and

Crew rests, crew work stations and passenger business centers with a door and smoke detection system (except the Combi Enlarged Lav/ Business Center) are empty, locked, closed and placarded INOPERATIVE – DO NOT ENTER.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.
The following EICAS message(s) may remain displayed:

numlitem.para: With supernumeraries on board, en route altitude must be limited to 10,000 feet MSL.
Equipment cooling may be operated in NORM or STBY.

Flight must remain with 60 minutes of a suitable landing airport. If operation with Equipment Cooling in OVRD mode becomes necessary, an unpressurized configuration yields insufficient equipment cooling. Flight time must be limited to 60 minutes when in OVRD mode.
A minimum of two packs is required.
With supernumeraries on board, flight is limited to an en route altitude of 10,000 feet MSL.
Main deck and lower lobe cargo compartments remain empty or contain only empty cargo handling equipment.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "FWD/AFT LL CARGO DOOR LATCH/HINGE – INOP – OPERATE UNPRESSURIZED". Placard crew rest area: "COMPARTMENT INOPERATIVE – DO NOT ENTER". Placard Cabin Pressurization Controller Selector "MODE A and MODE B INOP". Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)
